p: Besides the essential oil terpenes, from the aerial parts of S. virgaurea L., a number of at least 12 cis-clerodane lactones were reported in the 1980s, eight of which were new at the time of reporting [ 92]. In 2010, an additional set of nine new clerodanes were isolated from the species (most likely the aerial part, although up to date, many clerodanes have been isolated from roots of different Solidago species), seven of which have the relatively atypical feature of a carboxylic acid at C-19 (solidagoic acids C-I) [ 78].
